entry.string: Explain property types, data sources, validation, input & output representation.
Using the <xar:data-* ...> tags in your templates
Available tags: (replace 'users', '$uidlist' and '$uid' with your own)

this retrieves the dynamic properties defined for the 'users' module, and their value for all items listed in $uidlist. You'll need to build that uid list in your module function and pass it along to the template
this shows the value of dynamic property '$name' for item $uid, formatted for output
this shows the value of dynamic property '$name' for item $uid, formatted for input
(when you're looping over the individual items, and you want to add the dynamic values for item $uid)
this retrieves the dynamic properties defined for the 'users' module and item $uid. Note that we don't use value="..." here, since we only have one item
Idem for input forms, where you'd use <xar:data-input ... /> to show input fields
[+ Easter Egg : util meta -> export to XML -> save to file -> util import -> access your whole database via DD]
Utilities - Export Dynamic Data Object Definition
Utilities - Import Dynamic Data Object Definition
XML files found in Base Directory
Check to attempt to maintain item ids found in definition file
Choose a mapping to migrate data
Module which provides the original object
Item type to be migrated from.
List of items for this module+itemtype
Attempt to preserve item id during this migration
View module objects using dynamic data

entry.translation: Ungültiges #(1) bei #(2) Funktion #(3) () in Modul #(4) (nicht numerisch oder nicht gesetzt)

entry.string: Trying to modify this object may break the Dynamic Data module. Proceed with caution.

entry.string: When DD is used to extend some item (e.g. roles), then you should definitely avoid re-using property names that are already in the original item - just like you can't have 2 fields called 'state' in "static" items either. You should also avoid 'module', 'itemtype', 'itemid', 'transform' and 'returnurl' when using DD via hooks, because those are pre-defined parameters in hook calls.
Hint: after you create a property, the label and name are independent from each other. You can adapt the property name by clicking on the ID link above.
vertical layout of basically the same table as above (as requested by johnny, implemented by andyv) NOTE: if someone ever need the horisontal layout, then please implement a GUI switch
Click Flush Property Cache to clear the DynamicData Property Definitions cache and to reload the properties definitions from the file system.
The following property types are predefined in Xaraya and may be used in your own dynamic properties.
Add a new Property Type using the fields below.
Note: any changes you make here will be lost whenever the property cache gets flushed.
Deleting this object may break the Dynamic Data module.
Hint: empty the Label to delete a property for all items
entry.translation: Tipp: Das Label leeren um eine Eigenschaft für alle Elemente zu löschen

entry.string: Click on a Property Name to edit it.
entry.translation: Klicken Sie auf einen Eigenschaftsnamen, um diese zu bearbeiten.

entry.string: Warning! This is a system object used internally by the Dynamic Data module. Trying to modify the properties of this object may break the Dynamic Data module. Proceed with caution.
entry.translation: Warnung! Dies ist ein Systemobjekt, intern verwendet von dem DD-Modul. Der Versuch einer Änderung der Eigenschaften dieses Objektes kann eventuell zu Schwierigkeiten bei der weiteren Verwendung des DD_Moduls führen. Deshalb Vorsicht walten lassen.

entry.string: Note: for completely dynamic Objects like this one, you need to define one property that is of type "Item ID"
ERROR: the table has no primary key
